newsitem.title: GERMANY: ALPINE SKIING-PROFILE OF WOMEN'S WORLD CUP SLALOM WINNER.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-PROFILE OF WOMEN'S WORLD CUP SLALOM WINNER.

text.p: Following is a brief profile of Pernilla Wiberg, winner of a women's World Cup slalom on Sunday:

Overall World Cup wins: 18. Slalom: Bad Kleinkirchheim (1991), Waterville (91), Narvik (92), Steamboat (92), Veysonnaz (93,95), Morzine (94), Lenzerheide (95), Semmering I (95,96), Maribor (97), Zwiesel (97). Giant slalom: Lake Louise (91). Super-G Cortina (94), Lake Louise (96), Bad Kleinkirchheim (97). Combined: Sierra Nevada (94), Lenzerheide (95)

Other feats - Gold medal in giant slalom at 1991 world championships. Double gold medallist in slalom and combined event at 1996 world championships. Gold medal in giant slalom at 1992 Olympics. Gold medal in combined event at 1994 Olympics.

This winter the softly-spoken Wiberg has a superb chance for the overall World Cup title. Previously a specialist in technical disciplines, she has been performing well across the board this year. Third and fourth places in two giant slaloms in Zwiesel have also boosted her position in the standings. Before she came to the German resort she had struggled in giant slaloms, a discipline in which she was a top performer early in her career. Wiberg is a huge star in her native country and has even released a moderately successful pop record.
